snippet: Mortality rates had improved in recent decades, but years of war knocked the life expectancy back to 69 from 74 for men and to 76 from 79 for women....
abstract: Analysis published in journal The Lancet Global Health finds life expectancy for men in Syria has declined by five years--from 74 years to 69 years--since civil war began in 2011.
lead_paragraph: Mortality rates had improved in recent decades, but years of war knocked the life expectancy back to 69 from 74 for men and to 76 from 79 for women.

headline.main: Life Expectancy Falls by 5 Years for Syrian Men, New Analysis Finds
headline.print_headline: Life Expectancy Falls by 5 Years for Syrian Men, Analysis Finds

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
